column4: anyone knows what port is safe to use on a bit torrent??  The ports I am trying are blocked by my ISP
which ones have you tried and which one is your ISP?
it could be something else and not your ISP. are you behind a firewall? do you have a router?

could still be it, tho. the best way to check would be not using the router and testing with your modem directly connected to one of the machines. you could also set up port forwarding on your NAT, or DMZ. i doubt your ISP can block bittorrent ports, since bittorrent doesn't use any single well known port (and if your client does, that can be changed)
what port do you use??
your ISP can use traffic shaping, but that's different.
TCP port 57265 closed on MYIP
myip?
it's an ip of the form *.*.*.* where * = # from 1-254
you can't be serious. i just talked to you about NAT, DMZ and port forwarding and you're telling me what an IP address is? i'm asking what MYIP is... not what an IP address is.
LoL you want to know my ip?
no mate, i simply didn't understand what you meant up there :)
erm, i write code for a living O.o
no dice, I have to configure a port in my router to be able to use a bit torrent client???
yeah, that's quite common if you're behind a NAT
it used to work fine though with my linksys router
i usually set up one of my machines as DMZ and run bittorrent from there.
too many variables, not sure what you had, but trying to lead you to a possible solution to what you're having right now.
thanks, I'll take a look into my router later but first im going to see if it works on my neighbor's wireless, what are neighbors with open wireless for?
be fair tho :)
